text: The words of Amos, who was among the sheepbreeders of Tekoa, which he saw concerning Israel in the days of Uzziah king of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam the son of Joash, king of Israel, two years before the earthquake.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And he said:
“The Lord roars from Zion,
And utters His voice from Jerusalem;
The pastures of the shepherds mourn,
And the top of Carmel withers.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord:
“For three transgressions of Damascus, and for four,
I will not turn away its punishment,
Because they have threshed Gilead with implements of iron.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I will send a fire into the house of Hazael,
Which shall devour the palaces of Ben-Hadad.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will also break the gate bar of Damascus,
And cut off the inhabitant from the Valley of Aven,
And the one who holds the scepter from Beth Eden.
The people of Syria shall go captive to Kir,”
Says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord:
“For three transgressions of Gaza, and for four,
I will not turn away its punishment,
Because they took captive the whole captivity
To deliver them up to Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I will send a fire upon the wall of Gaza,
Which shall devour its palaces.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will cut off the inhabitant from Ashdod,
And the one who holds the scepter from Ashkelon;
I will turn My hand against Ekron,
And the remnant of the Philistines shall perish,”
Says the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord:
“For three transgressions of Tyre, and for four,
I will not turn away its punishment,
Because they delivered up the whole captivity to Edom,
And did not remember the covenant of brotherhood.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I will send a fire upon the wall of Tyre,
Which shall devour its palaces.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord:
“For three transgressions of Edom, and for four,
I will not turn away its punishment,
Because he pursued his brother with the sword,
And cast off all pity;
His anger tore perpetually,
And he kept his wrath forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I will send a fire upon Teman,
Which shall devour the palaces of Bozrah.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord:
“For three transgressions of the people of Ammon, and for four,
I will not turn away its punishment,
Because they ripped open the women with child in Gilead,
That they might enlarge their territory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I will kindle a fire in the wall of Rabbah,
And it shall devour its palaces,
Amid shouting in the day of battle,
And a tempest in the day of the whirlwind.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Their king shall go into captivity,
He and his princes together,”
Says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord:
“For three transgressions of Moab, and for four,
I will not turn away its punishment,
Because he burned the bones of the king of Edom to lime.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I will send a fire upon Moab,
And it shall devour the palaces of Kerioth;
Moab shall die with tumult,
With shouting and trumpet sound.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And I will cut off the judge from its midst,
And slay all its princes with him,”
Says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord:
“For three transgressions of Judah, and for four,
I will not turn away its punishment,
Because they have despised the law of the Lord,
And have not kept His commandments.
Their lies lead them astray,
Lies which their fathers followed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I will send a fire upon Judah,
And it shall devour the palaces of Jerusalem.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord:
“For three transgressions of Israel, and for four,
I will not turn away its punishment,
Because they sell the righteous for silver,
And the poor for a pair of sandals.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They pant after the dust of the earth which is on the head of the poor,
And pervert the way of the humble.
A man and his father go in to the same girl,
To defile My holy name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They lie down by every altar on clothes taken in pledge,
And drink the wine of the condemned in the house of their god.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Yet it was I who destroyed the Amorite before them,
Whose height was like the height of the cedars,
And he was as strong as the oaks;
Yet I destroyed his fruit above
And his roots beneath.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Also it was I who brought you up from the land of Egypt,
And led you forty years through the wilderness,
To possess the land of the Amorite.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I raised up some of your sons as prophets,
And some of your young men as Nazirites.
Is it not so, O you children of Israel?”
Says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“But you gave the Nazirites wine to drink,
And commanded the prophets saying,
‘Do not prophesy!’
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Behold, I am weighed down by you,
As a cart full of sheaves is weighed down.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
He shall not stand who handles the bow,
The swift of foot shall not escape,
Nor shall he who rides a horse deliver himself.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The most courageous men of might
Shall flee naked in that day,”
Says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear this word that the Lord has spoken against you, O children of Israel, against the whole family which I brought up from the land of Egypt, saying:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“You only have I known of all the families of the earth;
Therefore I will punish you for all your iniquities.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Can two walk together, unless they are agreed?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Will a lion roar in the forest, when he has no prey?
Will a young lion cry out of his den, if he has caught nothing?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Will a bird fall into a snare on the earth, where there is no trap for it?
Will a snare spring up from the earth, if it has caught nothing at all?
speaker: Narrator

text:
If a trumpet is blown in a city, will not the people be afraid?
If there is calamity in a city, will not the Lord have done it?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Surely the Lord God does nothing,
Unless He reveals His secret to His servants the prophets.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A lion has roared!
Who will not fear?
The Lord God has spoken!
Who can but prophesy?
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Proclaim in the palaces at Ashdod,
And in the palaces in the land of Egypt, and say:
‘Assemble on the mountains of Samaria;
See great tumults in her midst,
And the oppressed within her.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For they do not know to do right,’
Says the Lord,
‘Who store up violence and robbery in their palaces.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore thus says the Lord God:
“An adversary shall be all around the land;
He shall sap your strength from you,
And your palaces shall be plundered.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thus says the Lord:
“As a shepherd takes from the mouth of a lion
Two legs or a piece of an ear,
So shall the children of Israel be taken out
Who dwell in Samaria—
In the corner of a bed and on the edge of a couch!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear and testify against the house of Jacob,”
Says the Lord God, the God of hosts,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“That in the day I punish Israel for their transgressions,
I will also visit destruction on the altars of Bethel;
And the horns of the altar shall be cut off
And fall to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will destroy the winter house along with the summer house;
The houses of ivory shall perish,
And the great houses shall have an end,”
Says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear this word, you cows of Bashan, who are on the mountain of Samaria,
Who oppress the poor,
Who crush the needy,
Who say to your husbands, “Bring wine, let us drink!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord God has sworn by His holiness:
“Behold, the days shall come upon you
When He will take you away with fishhooks,
And your posterity with fishhooks.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will go out through broken walls,
Each one straight ahead of her,
And you will be cast into Harmon,”
Says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Come to Bethel and transgress,
At Gilgal multiply transgression;
Bring your sacrifices every morning,
Your tithes every three days.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving with leaven,
Proclaim and announce the freewill offerings;
For this you love,
You children of Israel!”
Says the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Also I gave you cleanness of teeth in all your cities,
And lack of bread in all your places;
Yet you have not returned to Me,”
Says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“I also withheld rain from you,
When there were still three months to the harvest.
I made it rain on one city,
I withheld rain from another city.
One part was rained upon,
And where it did not rain the part withered.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So two or three cities wandered to another city to drink water,
But they were not satisfied;
Yet you have not returned to Me,”
Says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“I blasted you with blight and mildew.
When your gardens increased,
Your vineyards,
Your fig trees,
And your olive trees,
The locust devoured them;
Yet you have not returned to Me,”
Says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
“I overthrew some of you,
As God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah,
And you were like a firebrand plucked from the burning;
Yet you have not returned to Me,”
Says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For behold,
He who forms mountains,
And creates the wind,
Who declares to man what his thought is,
And makes the morning darkness,
Who treads the high places of the earth—
The Lord God of hosts is His name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hear this word which I take up against you, a lamentation, O house of Israel:
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For thus says the Lord God:
“The city that goes out by a thousand
Shall have a hundred left,
And that which goes out by a hundred
Shall have ten left to the house of Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For thus says the Lord to the house of Israel:
“Seek Me and live;
speaker: Narrator

text:
But do not seek Bethel,
Nor enter Gilgal,
Nor pass over to Beersheba;
For Gilgal shall surely go into captivity,
And Bethel shall come to nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Seek the Lord and live,
Lest He break out like fire in the house of Joseph,
And devour it,
With no one to quench it in Bethel—
speaker: Narrator

text:
You who turn justice to wormwood,
And lay righteousness to rest in the earth!”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
He rains ruin upon the strong,
So that fury comes upon the fortress.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They hate the one who rebukes in the gate,
And they abhor the one who speaks uprightly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore, because you tread down the poor
And take grain taxes from him,
Though you have built houses of hewn stone,
Yet you shall not dwell in them;
You have planted pleasant vineyards,
But you shall not drink wine from them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I know your manifold transgressions
And your mighty sins:
Afflicting the just and taking bribes;
Diverting the poor from justice at the gate.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore the prudent keep silent at that time,
For it is an evil time.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Seek good and not evil,
That you may live;
So the Lord God of hosts will be with you,
As you have spoken.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hate evil, love good;
Establish justice in the gate.
It may be that the Lord God of hosts
Will be gracious to the remnant of Joseph.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore the Lord God of hosts, the Lord, says this:
“There shall be wailing in all streets,
And they shall say in all the highways,
‘Alas! Alas!’
They shall call the farmer to mourning,
And skillful lamenters to wailing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In all vineyards there shall be wailing,
For I will pass through you,”
Says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Woe to you who desire the day of the Lord!
For what good is the day of the Lord to you?
It will be darkness, and not light.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It will be as though a man fled from a lion,
And a bear met him!
Or as though he went into the house,
Leaned his hand on the wall,
And a serpent bit him!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Is not the day of the Lord darkness, and not light?
Is it not very dark, with no brightness in it?
speaker: Narrator

text:
“I hate, I despise your feast days,
And I do not savor your sacred assemblies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though you offer Me burnt offerings and your grain offerings,
I will not accept them,
Nor will I regard your fattened peace offerings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Take away from Me the noise of your songs,
For I will not hear the melody of your stringed instruments.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But let justice run down like water,
And righteousness like a mighty stream.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Did you offer Me sacrifices and offerings
In the wilderness forty years, O house of Israel?
speaker: Narrator

text:
You also carried Sikkuth your king
And Chiun, your idols,
The star of your gods,
Which you made for yourselves.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore I will send you into captivity beyond Damascus,”
Says the Lord, whose name is the God of hosts.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Woe to you who are at ease in Zion,
And trust in Mount Samaria,
Notable persons in the chief nation,
To whom the house of Israel comes!
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Woe to you who put far off the day of doom,
Who cause the seat of violence to come near;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who lie on beds of ivory,
Stretch out on your couches,
Eat lambs from the flock
And calves from the midst of the stall;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who sing idly to the sound of stringed instruments,
And invent for yourselves musical instruments like David;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who drink wine from bowls,
And anoint yourselves with the best ointments,
But are not grieved for the affliction of Joseph.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore they shall now go captive as the first of the captives,
And those who recline at banquets shall be removed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord God has sworn by Himself,
The Lord God of hosts says:
“I abhor the pride of Jacob,
And hate his palaces;
Therefore I will deliver up the city
And all that is in it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then it shall come to pass, that if ten men remain in one house, they shall die.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And when a relative of the dead, with one who will burn the bodies, picks up the bodies to take them out of the house, he will say to one inside the house, “Are there any more with you?”
Then someone will say, “None.”
And he will say, “Hold your tongue! For we dare not mention the name of the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For behold, the Lord gives a command:
He will break the great house into bits,
And the little house into pieces.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do horses run on rocks?
Does one plow there with oxen?
Yet you have turned justice into gall,
And the fruit of righteousness into wormwood,
speaker: Narrator

text:
You who rejoice over Lo Debar,
Who say, “Have we not taken Karnaim for ourselves
By our own strength?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
“But, behold, I will raise up a nation against you,
O house of Israel,”
Says the Lord God of hosts;
“And they will afflict you from the entrance of Hamath
To the Valley of the Arabah.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus the Lord God showed me: Behold, He formed locust swarms at the beginning of the late crop; indeed it was the late crop after the king’s mowings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And so it was, when they had finished eating the grass of the land, that I said:
“O Lord God, forgive, I pray!
Oh, that Jacob may stand,
For he is small!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
So the Lord relented concerning this.
“It shall not be,” said the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus the Lord God showed me: Behold, the Lord God called for conflict by fire, and it consumed the great deep and devoured the territory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then I said:
“O Lord God, cease, I pray!
Oh, that Jacob may stand,
For he is small!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
So the Lord relented concerning this.
“This also shall not be,” said the Lord God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus He showed me: Behold, the Lord stood on a wall made with a plumb line, with a plumb line in His hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And the Lord said to me, “Amos, what do you see?”
And I said, “A plumb line.”
Then the Lord said:
“Behold, I am setting a plumb line
In the midst of My people Israel;
I will not pass by them anymore.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The high places of Isaac shall be desolate,
And the sanctuaries of Israel shall be laid waste.
I will rise with the sword against the house of Jeroboam.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Amaziah the priest of Bethel sent to Jeroboam king of Israel, saying, “Amos has conspired against you in the midst of the house of Israel. The land is not able to bear all his words.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For thus Amos has said:
‘Jeroboam shall die by the sword,
And Israel shall surely be led away captive
From their own land.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then Amaziah said to Amos:
“Go, you seer!
Flee to the land of Judah.
There eat bread,
And there prophesy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But never again prophesy at Bethel,
For it is the king’s sanctuary,
And it is the royal residence.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then Amos answered, and said to Amaziah:
“I was no prophet,
Nor was I a son of a prophet,
But I was a sheepbreeder
And a tender of sycamore fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then the Lord took me as I followed the flock,
And the Lord said to me,
‘Go, prophesy to My people Israel.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now therefore, hear the word of the Lord:
You say, ‘Do not prophesy against Israel,
And do not spout against the house of Isaac.’
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: Thus the Lord God showed me: Behold, a basket of summer fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And He said, “Amos, what do you see?”
So I said, “A basket of summer fruit.”
Then the Lord said to me:
“The end has come upon My people Israel;
I will not pass by them anymore.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And the songs of the temple
Shall be wailing in that day,”
Says the Lord God—
“Many dead bodies everywhere,
They shall be thrown out in silence.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear this, you who swallow up the needy,
And make the poor of the land fail,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Saying:
“When will the New Moon be past,
That we may sell grain?
And the Sabbath,
That we may trade wheat?
Making the ephah small and the shekel large,
Falsifying the scales by deceit,
speaker: Narrator

text:
That we may buy the poor for silver,
And the needy for a pair of sandals—
Even sell the bad wheat?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord has sworn by the pride of Jacob:
“Surely I will never forget any of their works.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Shall the land not tremble for this,
And everyone mourn who dwells in it?
All of it shall swell like the River,
Heave and subside
Like the River of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
“Behold, the days are coming,” says the Lord God,
“That I will send a famine on the land,
Not a famine of bread,
Nor a thirst for water,
But of hearing the words of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They shall wander from sea to sea,
And from north to east;
They shall run to and fro, seeking the word of the Lord,
But shall not find it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“In that day the fair virgins
And strong young men
Shall faint from thirst.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who swear by the sin of Samaria,
Who say,
‘As your god lives, O Dan!’
And, ‘As the way of Beersheba lives!’
They shall fall and never rise again.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
I saw the Lord standing by the altar, and He said:
“Strike the doorposts, that the thresholds may shake,
And break them on the heads of them all.
I will slay the last of them with the sword.
He who flees from them shall not get away,
And he who escapes from them shall not be delivered.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Though they go into captivity before their enemies,
From there I will command the sword,
And it shall slay them.
I will set My eyes on them for harm and not for good.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord God of hosts,
He who touches the earth and it melts,
And all who dwell there mourn;
All of it shall swell like the River,
And subside like the River of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He who builds His layers in the sky,
And has founded His strata in the earth;
Who calls for the waters of the sea,
And pours them out on the face of the earth—
The Lord is His name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Are you not like the people of Ethiopia to Me,
O children of Israel?” says the Lord.
“Did I not bring up Israel from the land of Egypt,
The Philistines from Caphtor,
And the Syrians from Kir?
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Behold, the eyes of the Lord God are on the sinful kingdom,
And I will destroy it from the face of the earth;
Yet I will not utterly destroy the house of Jacob,”
Says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“For surely I will command,
And will sift the house of Israel among all nations,
As grain is sifted in a sieve;
Yet not the smallest grain shall fall to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All the sinners of My people shall die by the sword,
Who say, ‘The calamity shall not overtake nor confront us.’
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
That they may possess the remnant of Edom,
And all the Gentiles who are called by My name,”
Says the Lord who does this thing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Behold, the days are coming,” says the Lord,
“When the plowman shall overtake the reaper,
And the treader of grapes him who sows seed;
The mountains shall drip with sweet wine,
And all the hills shall flow with it.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I will plant them in their land,
And no longer shall they be pulled up
From the land I have given them,”
Says the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator
